original: Ericsson, Ake Sten Johan Ferris, apotekare, Alingsås, f. 9/5/09 i Gbg av apot. John E. o. Amalia Johansson. G. 45 m. Gerd Flood. — Stud:ex. v, Beskowska sk. i Sthlm 32, farm. kand. 37, apot:ex. 42. Res. t. Finl. 40, Danm. 41. Elev v. apot. i Vaggeryd 34-36, anst. där 37, v. apot. i Jönköp. o. Huskvarna 37, v. Storken i Borås 38-39, v. apot. i Alingsås sed. 42. V. ordf. i Alingsås kortdistansskyttefören. 43-45.
translated: Ericsson, Ake Sten Johan Ferris, pharmacist, from Alingsås, born May 9th, 1909 in Gothenburg to pharmacist John E. and Amalia Johansson. Married in 1945 to Gerd Flood. He completed his secondary education from Beskowska school in Stockholm in 1932, earned a pharmaceutical degree in 1937, and became a licensed pharmacist in 1942 after training at various locations including Finland and Denmark. He worked as a pharmacy assistant in Vaggeryd from 1934 to 1936, employed there in 1937, as well as in Jönköping and Huskvarna from 1937 to 1938, and at Storken in Borås from 1938 to 1939. From 1942 onwards, he was an assistant pharmacist in Alingsås. He served as vice chairman of the Alingsås short-range shooting association from 1943 to 1945.
